alert.note: Alert for McDowell; Northwest Raleigh; Southeast Raleigh; Wyoming (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 29 at 11:28PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern McDowell, south central Raleigh and central Wyoming Counties through MIDNIGHT EDT... At 1127 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Pineville, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Welch, Pineville, Mullens, Sophia, Crab Orchard, Coal City, Twin Falls State Park, Lester, Kimball, Rhodell, Wolf Pen, Josephine, Maben and Herndon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
